TopicTitle: Root Part Below a Decoupler Causes Problems to Top Stage

Articles.Content:
KSP2 Version: 0.1.2.0.22258
Operating System: Windows 10
CPU+GPU+RAM: i9 9900K+3070ti+32GB
Mods Used: None

Root Part at Stage Below Top of Rocket:

Spoiler

Video Evidence:
https://youtu.be/7AaDpdAEgVI (21 Seconds)

Steps to Replicate:

  1. Load 0120RootPart2ndTankStdDecouple
  2. Reload 0120RootPart2ndTankStdDecouple (to avoid another bug)
  3. Right Click on the Poodle at the top of the craft to get up Parts Manager information.
  4. Stage
  5. Stage
  6. Right Click on top Poodle to reopen Parts Manager information.
  7. Increase Throttle to full.
  8. Stage
  9. Stage

Save File:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/sc4sc4a4gufeph6/0120RootPart2ndTankStdDecouple.zip?dl=0
Craft File:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/d9m9wtyub0zw745/PoodleSecondTankRootPart.zip?dl=0

 

Root Part at Top Stage (Normal):

Spoiler

Video Evidence:
https://youtu.be/WoY-_-zi4Io (16 Seconds)

Save File:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/gegmvnqyzcwypmv/0120RootPartPodStdDecouple.zip?dl=0
Craft File:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/2te14tplfzsvpnb/PoodlePodTankRootPart.zip?dl=0

 

Comparison:

Things To Note:

  • Previous stage's engines stay on.
  • Parts Manager Collapses its information.
  • SAS turns off after staging.
  • Throttle Drops to zero.
  • Parachute doesn't deploy.
  • Poodle's parts manager Activate/Deactivate inverts. So Activate Deactivates and Deactivates Activates.

Additional Information:
This doesn't test for if the root part was even down further on the rocket.
Very well analize! There are many bugs with decoupling for now
